intro: Aporosa lunata var. philippinensis, commonly known as the Philippine moonseed, is a flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its palmate leaves and small, clustered white flowers. The plant produces yellowish-orange berries that contain the seeds. It typically grows in lowland forests and is often found in moist, shaded environments. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species in its native range.
